newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks seen cautious on lingering baht worry.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks seen cautious on lingering baht worry.

text.p: After plunging to near eight-year lows on Wednesday, Thai stocks were expected to remain cautious on Thursday with continued foreign selling likely on persistent concerns about the battered baht, brokers said.

"There will be some hangover from the foreign sell-off yesterday," said one broker at local house. "The market would remain fragile as the baht remains under selling pressure in the foreign exchange market."
The Thai baht firmed early on Thursday after intervention on Wednesday to defend the currency. But selling pressure still persists in the market, traders said.

The baht was quoted at 25.910/25.940 early against the dollar versus 26.330/26.430 in late trade on Wednesday. The Bank of Thailand fixed the mid-rate at 25.81 to the dollar against 25.85 on Wednesday.
The Bank of Thailand on Wednesday teamed up with the Monetary Authority of Singapore to intervene in the Singapore market to stabilise the baht.
The SET index tumbled 28.94 points or 4.82 percent to close at 571.30 on economic worries and baht jitters. Turnover amounted to 6.6 billion baht trade.
